title-group.article-title: Error Estimates in L<sup>2</sup>, H<sup>1</sup> and L<sup>infty</sup> in Covolume Methods for Elliptic and Parabolic Problems: A Unified Approach

abstract.p: In this paper we consider covolume or finite volume element methods for variable coefficient elliptic and parabolic problems on convex smooth domains in the plane. We introduce a general approach for connecting these methods with finite element method analysis. This unified approach is used to prove known convergence results in the H<sup>1</sup>, L<sup>2</sup> norms and new results in the max-norm. For the elliptic problems we demonstrate that the error u - u<sub>h</sub> between the exact solution u and the approximate solution u<sub>h</sub> in the maximum norm is O(h<sup>2</sup>| ln h|) in the linear element case. Furthermore, the maximum norm error in the gradient is shown to be of first order. Similar results hold for the parabolic problems.
